channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024110489
item.description:
Report E-2024110489

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1028 ET, XPO-XSL notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of El Pinol 85 released from 55-gallon metal drum due to unknown cause. The release impacted inside trailer#311-3798. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste was placed in (1) 85-gallon metal drum along with oil dri.

item.title: Report E-2024110433
item.description:
Report E-2024110433

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-26T12:24:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1641 ET, LSL notified ERTS of a cargo release in St. Louis, MO. It was reported that approximately half a cup of potassium permanganate released from 10-gallon poly drum due to improper loading. The release impacted inside trailer#ITSB5622. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cups of Organic Superior Quality Permanganate product released from lids of (6) 10-gallon poly drums. Contractors wiped the lids where leaking occurred with absorbent rags and placed them into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110684
item.description:
Report X-2024110684

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER OBSERVED WET CARTON ON EAST DOCK PURPLE BELT. RESPONDER RECOVERED CARTON AND TRANSPORTED IT TO DMP WORK AREA FOR ANALYSIS. UPON OPENING CARTON, LOOSE CAP WAS OBSERVED ON INNER CONTAINER RESULTING IN SPILLAGE. PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED FOLLOWING DMP PROCEDURES.
